intro: Salvia clusii, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a perennial herb native to Mexico. It is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stalks rise above the foliage, terminating in a distinctive spiky flower cluster. Salvia clusii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun.
